title: Belgrade International Week of Architecture (BINA)

author: Danica Jovović Prodanović, BINA - Belgrade International Architecture Week

segmentation: I'm also very glad to be here on the behalf of the Buggy International Week of Architecture.
We this is the 10th.
This year it was the 10th edition of the of Our festival.
And we started in 2006.
We started as a week long event and during these past years we have grown into a bigger event month long event.
It's a platform that promotes contemporary architecture and all that you can see.
It's written here, but I think what is interesting for us is that we have started.
We started as as two organizations, working organizations working together.
It's Association of Belgrade, architectures and NGO.
And the Cultural Center of Belgrade, a city culture, institution.
And this is, we think, quite an important thing, because on one side we have a professional audience and then the other very wide audience.
Because culture center of Belgrade is organization that exists for 60 years now and has a very open program.
A lot of people and the most of all which is important but with cultures.
Health Center has the premises in the very center of the city, so this is very useful for us to use it for our exhibitions.
The panels, lectures and everything else.
So it's a multidisciplinary event with lots of exhibitions, lectures, debates, conferences, workshops for children.
So it's very open to very wide public and as you see we have up to 17,000 visitors per week per year.
I mean for this annual event, which is almost a month long.
So we started as a team of 510 years ago, but then we're all architects coming from various backgrounds.

Some of us are working in culture institutional somewhere at the University, and some of us are practicing active architects doing design and having their own fair firms with as in these ten years we've been supported with the help for lot of our friends and and students and volunteers.
And if we're talking about the financing, 1/3 of our income income is coming from the side of the city and the Ministry of Culture.
So let's say from state, then the other third is coming from the various international foundations, foreign embassies, culture centers, and 1/3 is coming from the side with sponsors and donors.
For the occasion of the 10th being out this year, we made it in this opener Air Exhibition, which will see at the end of this presentation.
But this is just one part of it that we did a little statistics who is being a team.
Six of ours.
And of course there are more women as you see, because more women in organization, more women in public, in the audience.
Participants are.
Haha, so this is the situation in Serbia.
If you're talking about architecture and doing programs on architecture.
So this is a little bit about concept.
It's an invitation to professional and general public, and what we feel is really a big entrance.
Interest of the general public because we're really addressing both professional and general public and we have big big interests of this general public.

So that's that's why we we think that their input on the future of the architecture is also very important, and that's why we we try to involve a lot of young people, a lot of students, children, and of course a lot of professionals.
So it's also a business event.
And it brings a lot of large number of firms that are promoting their creativity and innovations in the field of architecture and.
Urban planning an most important thing, be nice, completely non-profit festival and all programs are free.
So this is the spot where the culture center is situated and this is the opening of one of the of the fest.

Tools we organize our programs, our exhibitions and lectures within various venues around the city so they we open exhibitions in museums in the University and this is and of course we also organize the themed works which are also very, very popular and people really like to enjoy.
And each year we have about.
10 to 15 different theme works.
Or
Organized.
This exhibition was dedicated to doomed architect above them Bogdanovich that we mentioned yesterday at yesterday's conference here and that was organized in the Belgrade City Museum.
We are focused on local architecture, regional architecture.
Each year we try to present some of the regional architecture practices.
So during these ten years we managed to do it with.
Slovenia, Croatia, Kosovo and Macedonia.
So I think that Bosnia and Herzegovina and on the other side we promote local local practices, so pedestrian zone of Novi Saad was presented this year.
It's vojvodina.
It's part of Serbia and also international experience.
So this was the exhibition on Scandinavian housing.
This area, among within our program.

We also organize conferences, so last year we had an international conference about citizens and City making and about this very actual participatory process is in urban planning and city making, and we also prepare the material about the last year's conference and the last year program so you can see what it was.
All about.

And of course, we try as much as possible to tour our exhibitions, so this was 1 exhibition that was made together with the center from the promotion of science and Disparity Museum and being an international week of architecture, it was presented in London during the London Festival of Architecture and it was dealing with about all it was dealing on the issue of of housing from the period of nearly 220 one 21st century on.
Our local Belgrade's territory and it was dealing with Vincze culture and I think it was quite interesting because on the other hand it was compared to the socialist architecture of the new Belgrade.

We're also doing a lot of trying to do as much as possible international cooperation, so one of our projects that we actually first did with the with mall was unfinished modernization between utopian pragmatism and after these two year project.
A lot of different, and I think that was the most important thing apart from very good quality program and and lots of exhibitions and panels and everything that happened during this project.
The Dish Network was built, so I think this that future architecture and as being here is also the result of this very successful project that we did.
Gather.

And also we tried to do some practical things and this was the result of one of student workshops that we did together with Norwegian architects, that was cabins, Scandinavian cabin done completely out of wood and it was the concept and and.

Complete Project was made together with students and professors coming from both countries, Norway, Norway and Serbia, and it was supported by Nardi Nordic Culture Fund and now this, this little cabin is situated in the yard of the Academy of Fine Arts.
So we're using it for student workshops for both students of architecture and art.
And this is this open air exhibition that was prepared for for the last.
OK for the last been in Belgrade, and it's dealing mostly of the fact that was.
About the effects of been about the countries that were presented, I mean, architects coming from various countries.
So it was about 700 people coming to being a participating in our programs.

If we know that in Belgrade there is no such a thing as an architecture museum, I think that this is quite an important initiative, although it's it's not completely on the level of the museum activity.
But still, I think that our presence is very relevant and.
We are really looking forward to to go on with all different kinds of activities and of course we're very glad that we are the part of this platform.
So we are glad and we hope that you have a good platform and work together nicely in the future.
So the future of architecture is in their hands and.
Be nice to be continued, and of course our joint activities.
Thank you.
